title: Relay Race
description: Puppy will go through a relay race and at each stop they will have to do one action
instruction: Lay 3 objects out on the floor
Go to each object and ask for one position (ie. sit, stand, down)
goal: To have puppy respond to cue next to the handler
challenge: Sprinkle kibble between objects.

title: Perch with Kibble
description: Puppy will perch on an object with kibble on it
instruction: Grab a box or small stool
Put kibble on top of object
Perch away!
*tip* if you think puppy will eat it, tape the kibble to the object
goal: Playful perch
challenge: Add more kibble

title: Heel and Side
description: Stand and cue your puppy for Heel and Side
instruction: Stand still and use only your voice
Say Heel puppy will go to your left side and sit
Say Side puppy will go to your right side and sit
Puppy should only cross in front of you
If puppy sits too far try doing this by a wall
goal: Puppy understands side and heel
challenge: Say side or heel twice in a row and see what your pup does

title: Duration Sit, Down, Stand
description: Puppy will hold position
instruction: Cue the puppy
...Patiently wait
say Yes before they break
goal: Puppy holds position
challenge: Distract puppy as they hold the position (be creative)

title: Dress Up
description: Have family members dress up in costumes or sports gear or hats and sunglasses and move around the house; Be weird for your puppy.
instruction: Find strange things
put them on and interact with your puppy
goal: Visual Enrichment for your puppy
challenge: nothing here

title: Obstacle Course
description: You know ninja warrior? Try puppy warrior
instruction: Be creative
Take your chairs and make a tunnel for the puppy to go through
Put around some empty milk jugs
Put tin foil on the floor for your puppy to walk on
Hang up some things that brush against your puppy
goal: Visual/Active enrichment for your puppy
challenge: See if you can make it through the course :)

title: Move Furniture
description: Move around familiar things. Some dogs are thrown off by changes in familiar environments
instruction: Move their dog bed
Change where they have dinner
Move the welcome mat to the bedroom door
The list goes on
goal: Visual enrichment for your puppy
challenge: Nothing here

title: Hide and Seek
description: Put puppy into a position (sit, stand, down, etc.). Get puppy to find you
instruction: Put puppy into position
Sneakily move around the house and hide
Remember to keep it easy the first few times, set up the pup for success
Call out to your puppy using a command that breaks position, ie. puppy puppy!
goal: Make your puppy think
challenge: Sneakily move around the house and backtrack. I think the puppies listen to where you go. Play some music or sprinkle some kibble on the ground

title: Impressions
description: Change your voice and see if your puppy responds
instruction: Do your best (or worst) impression
Give command to puppy
goal: Auditory enrichment
challenge: Change the pitch and tone of your voice too. Be excited, be sad, be an actor/actress

title: Make Strange Noises
description: Make noises, remember not to startle your puppy. Aim for interest
instruction: Whistle
Play random music. Sometimes I play the sound of bacon frying
Whistle, make bird noises
Bang pots and pans
Run the vacuum
goal: Auditory enrichment
challenge: Dance around excitedly too

title: Feeding Time
description: Make your puppy work for their food
instruction: Feed puppy from slow feeder, stuffed kong, snuffle mat or hand feed
goal: Food based enrichment
challenge: Say a command and see if they stop eating. Reward if they do :)

title: Kibble Challenge
description: have your puppy sit still while you write their name in kibble
instruction: Set your puppy in a position (sit, down, stand)
Use kibble and write their name on the floor
Keep it easy and take photos, you can hand feed periodically and say "good"
clean up the mess and give your puppy a treat!
goal: Teach puppy not to eat food off the ground and self-control
challenge: Can your puppy do this in a stand?

title: Kibble on Body
description: have your puppy be still while you put kibble on their body
instruction: Set your puppy in a down position
Put kibble on the top of their paws and say mine so they do not eat it
Say Release and let them eat the kibble!
goal: Teach puppy self-control
challenge: Put it all over their body! Extra points for the head and nose. Make sure the food doesn't fall onto the floor when you say release

title: Rolling balls
description: Roll balls around puppy and they should not react
instruction: Roll ball
When puppy does not react, treat!
If puppy is ball-driven, avoid this one
goal: Teach puppy ball are not a big deal
challenge: Roll more balls and other objects!

title: Find It
description: Have puppy search for toy
instruction: Get puppy exited about their favorite chew or tug toy
Cue puppy into a position
Hide the toy close by
Say find it, when puppy finds the toy get really excited and play with them!
goal: Stimulate the puppy
challenge: Hide it in harder places

title: Traffic Light Game
description: Have puppy respond to commands like sit, stand, down as they move towards you
instruction: Cue puppy into a position and walk away
Call puppy over, (ie. puppy puppy, here, release)
As puppy comes towards you say a command and they should stop and execute it
Click or say yes then treat!
goal: Puppy executes cues at a distance
challenge: do multiple cues per game (ie. sit, release, down, release, here, Yes!

title: Bed/Kennel Relay
description: Cue puppy towards you or into a position then reward at the bed or kennel
instruction: Give puppy cue
Mark behaviour then throw treat to the kennel or bed
Repeat and laugh as you bounce the puppy back and forth
Improve your aim and don't throw it onto the floor
goal: Puppy gets some physical stimulation
challenge: Leave kibble on the ground for them to avoid or do this from a greater distance

title: Food Bag Foraging
description: Let puppy forage for food in the food bag
instruction: This one is quite complex find the detailed guide @ https://hydrant.pads.ca/food-bag-foraging/
Cue puppy into position
Set yo an empty food bag with a few kibble inside
Release the puppy or use Go Sniff command
Try to recall your puppy
If they do not respond, try using less enticing items in the bag
goal: Teach puppy explicit permission and have them be comfortable in enclosed spaces. Also teach puppy to listen to commands in the presence of food
challenge: Add better food in the bag

title: This Way
description: Get the puppy to move in your general direction when you say the cue
instruction: Cue the puppy into position (sit, stand, down)
Say this way move away
If puppy leaves position and moves towards you, mark and treat
goal: Have a good command to use to recall puppy. This is less formal than lets go or here
challenge: Change your voice or wear silly clothing

title: Name Game In Position
description: Puppy will look at you when you say their name or focus and not leave position
instruction: Remember saying puppies name or focus is not a cue to break position
Give puppy a cue (ie. down, sit, stand)
Say their name or say focus
When they look and don't move, mark and reward!
goal: Puppy understands their name/focus is not a cue to break position

title: Odd Position Commands
description: Give your puppy cues in different positions
instruction: Make it easy! If you usually give cues standing up, crouch down slightly
You can work it until you are lying down on the ground giving commands
Get into your position
Give cue to puppy
When they execute, mark and reward
goal: Puppy understands cues no matter what position you are in
challenge: Try giving side and heel commands in a sitting position (surprisingly hard)

title: Romantic Dinner
description: Hand feed your puppy
instruction: Make it romantic, dim the lights and play some music
Get in cuddle position or sit at the couch, then hand feed your pup
You can even pretend to eat the food so your puppy thinks you are sharing food with them
goal: Puppy builds trust with handler
challenge: Try doing this without wiping the drool off your hands

title: Cuddle Session
description: Sit down with your puppy and watch TV or play games
instruction: Get a comfy spot and relax
challenge: Just relax

title: Puppy Dress Up
description: Have clothes that you don't wear? Try them out on the puppy
instruction: Find clothes
Put them on puppy
Praise and reward them for their patience and take photos!
goal: Puppy feels comfortable with objects on their body

title: Stair Walk
description: Walk with puppy up and down stairs
instruction: Take one step up the stairs
Mark and reward puppy for following beside you
Do this for each step of the stairs
Once puppy starts staying next to you consistently, you can space out rewards
goal: Puppy is engaged with handler and does not dart up the stairs
challenge: Try going down the stairs or leave kibble on the steps

title: Puppy Hockey
description: Slide food to your puppy's body and do not let them eat it
instruction: Cue puppy into down
Slide kibble towards them
You can aim for their body at first, or if you want a challenge aim between their front paws
Praise and reward them for not eating the kibble off the ground
goal: Puppy does not eat food off the floor
challenge: Try rolling other objects like balls or higher value food

title: Pushups with the Puppy
description: Work out with your puppy
instruction: Assume push up position, puppy will be in a Stand/Sit position
Go down and tell puppy to Down
Go up and tell puppy Sit or Stand
goal: Puppy gets some excercise and so do you

title: Snout Challenge
description: Have puppy put their nose through a circle made with your hands
instruction: Search up snout challenge on google to get an idea of what to do
Go down and tell puppy to Down
Go up and tell puppy Sit or Stand
goal: Puppy does not mind putting snout into loops
challenge: Try increasing the distance between you and your pup

title: Out Game With Door
description: Have puppy cross door thresholds
instruction: Stand by a doorway and say out
When puppy crosses threshold, mark and reward
Remember out just means cross the threshold; So if you say out repeatedly they should just go back and forth
goal: Reinforce puppy's knowledge of out
challenge: Give them random commands so they don't pick up a pattern. Ie. sit, stand, down before saying out

title: Carpet Bomb
description: Puppy only eats kibble that falls onto their mat
instruction: Lay out a large mat for your puppy
Drop kibble one at a time from the sky
Puppy may only eat kibble that falls onto the mat
goal: Puppy learns food on the floor is no good
challenge: Try dropping several kibble at a time

title: Mine Yours
description: Puppy knows to leave what isn't his and will have it with your permission
instruction: Put kibble on puppy's paw and say mine
Puppy should not eat the kibble
Say yours and the puppy can eat it!
Alternatively, use a chew toy; let puppy chew then say mine. He should release it to you
goal: Puppy learns self control
challenge: increase duration

title: Dinner word game
description: Puppy only eats meal after you say Yes
instruction: Fill bowl with food
Hold bowl up until puppy sits and waits
Lower food bowl. Puppy should not eat until you say Yes
Now for the fun, say random words to play with your puppy
Pester, Zest, Pest, Crest, Coalesce, Fest, etc.
goal: Puppy learns self control

title: It's your choice
description: Puppy learns in order to get what they want, they need to do what you want
instruction: close hand around kibble and let dog sniff. They do not get the treat
Anchor arm on knee to prevent movement
Open hand when he stops trying to get the treat
Hand opening signals puppy is doing something right
If puppy goes in to get the treat without your permission close hand
When puppy waits patiently you may treat them
goal: Puppy makes good choices

title: Go Go Stop
description: Puppy will follow handler at different speeds
instruction: Cue puppy into Lets Go position
Walk slowly if puppy stays by your side treat
Try walking faster and then stop
If puppy is still at your side treat and repeat
If puppy is not at your side, guide pupppy into proper position, do not treat
Try again
goal: Puppy will pay attention to handler while walking
challenge: Add in inside and outside turns. Puppy should stay by your side

title: Head Lower
description: Shaping dog to lower head to ground
instruction: This is done with the puppy in the Down Position
Initially reward for head movement
Then focus on head moving in a downward direction
You may treat from the bottom to encourage head to go there
Or you can treat away to reset his head position
Keep shaping as the dogs head gets lower and lower
goal: For the trainer; learn how to shape behaviours

title: Read a Book
description: Puppy reading time
instruction: Read a book to your puppy
Be extra creative and change sounds for each character
goal: Have puppy relax to your voice
challenge: Read a book while doing puppy yoga (have puppy on their back)

title: Fake shower
description: New environment for puppy
instruction: Bring puppy to bathtub or shower stall
Move them around and treat here and there
Make shower time a good experience (should help for future showers)
goal: New surface for the puppy. Especially if it's slippery
challenge: Make the tub slightly wet

title: Puddle walk
description: Have puppy walk over puddles
instruction: This can be done on your patio with a shallow pan of water
Have puppy walk into the water
Best reaction is no reaction
Treat when they walk over or onto the puddle
Apparently some dogs have trouble walking over puddles, especially during summer
goal: Desensitize puppy to puddles

title: Reprogram Cues (Homework)
description: Learn how to reprogram behaviours from old cues
instruction: Remember the pattern -- new cue => old cue => treat
Puppy should know the Bed command on cue
We will associate a door bell sound to the bed command
Warm up with a normal bed command, treat puppy when they do it
Play door bell sound then say bed, treat puppy when they do it
Repeat
You will know the puppy is getting it when they go towards the bed after hearing the door bell
goal: Puppy hears doorbell and will go to bed. Puppy knows how to change cues, I think this is good if PADS changes commands
